fact: Japan has more than 5 million vending machines—one for about every 25 people!
The Amazon Rainforest, largely in Brazil, produces 20% of the world’s oxygen.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world combined.
The Great Pyramid of Giza is the only one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World still standing.
Australia is home to more kangaroos than people.
South Korea has the fastest internet speeds in the world.
Norway was ranked the world's happiest country in multiple years and has one of the highest standards of living.
India is the world's largest democracy by population and has over 22 official languages.
Iceland runs almost entirely on renewable energy—mostly geothermal and hydropower.
Chocolate originated in ancient Mexico, where the Aztecs believed cacao beans were a gift from the gods.
New Zealand has no native land mammals (except for bats) and is home to the famous, flightless kiwi bird.
